resource.chars:
It now gives me the greatest 
pleasure to be able to commu-
nicate a further confirmation 
not only of my own ideas 
with regard to the gradual 
insinuation of air between 
mercury & glass but also 
of Mr. Faraday’s observations 
on the same subject, the 
accuracy of which have been 
very unnecessarily called into 
question. The authority upon
which this confirmation rests 
<s>upon<\s> is that of Dr Priestly,
whose acuteness of observation 
has been too well established 
to be lightly called into question 
by any one. The following 
extract is taken from the 
third volume of his Observations 
on Air published in the year 
1786 (page 336)
